result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Louis Glinski

records.addlTxt: Initial appearance on November 8, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:35 AM Defendant Paul Louis Glinski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Court states Attorney Restemayer was present for other initial appearances today however is not able to be reached at this time. The court will schedule an adjourned Initial appearance.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 13, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Paul Louis Glinski not in court.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Paul Louis Glinski.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Restemayer requests the intitial appearance be rescheduled due to the defendant being incarcerated and not being able to make a connection through zoom. Da Kelz gives 09/13/2022 at 10:00 AM

10:20 AM Defendant Paul Louis Glinski not in court.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer in court for Paul Louis Glinski. Attorney Restemayer states his client is currently in the Clark County Jail and is unavailable to appear today as the jail was not given notice. Attorney Restemayer requests an adjourned initial appearance. DA Kelz scheduled the Adjourned Initial hearing for 08/23/2022 at 10:00 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: 10:06 AM Defendant Paul Louis Glinski appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he has not received a copy of the criminal complaint. Defendant states he would like to obtain counsel for this matter and adjourn until he receives the criminal complaint which was mailed to the Defendant at the Clark County Jail. DA Kelz sets an adjourned initial appearances for 07/19/2022 at 10 AM. Notice of right to attorney given to DE.
Demand for discovery and notice of intent to use DNA

Defendant may not have contact with the individual(s): R.L.S unless a written waiver is filed with the Clerk of Courts Office OR the Price County Sheriff's Office outside of normal business hours 
*No Contact includes: Going to or remaining in any place the individual resides, is employed at, attends school at, or any public location the individual is temporarily located. Contact through means of telephone. Electronic devices, Social media, email, regular mail, or a 3rd party individual is prohibited. The only exception to this order is contact through your attorney or law enforcement in appropriate circumstances. 
Defendant shall not go upon the property of: N7956 State Hwy 13 in the City of Phillips, WI

2:35 PM DA calls case and states appearances and possible charges. Paul Glinki appeared via video from Price County Jail. Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DE next court date is 06/14/2022 at 10 am.  Jail gives DE a notice of right to attorney.  Court questions parties as to bond.  DA states bond recommendation. Bond ordered as requested.
